title: `%%time` does not stop execution on exceptions
body:
- https://github.com/ipython/ipython/issues/14889 reported that interruption does not stop execution of `%%time`,
- which was fixed by https://github.com/ipython/ipython/pull/14890

However, non-system exceptions also allow the execution to continue although it should not. Instead, we should probably call `sys.exit(SIGINT)` after any exception gets caught.

title: SyntaxError raised too early when typing code
body:
Consider this valid Python code:
```py
def foo():
    def bar():
        return val
    def bax():
        nonlocal val
        return val

    val = 42
    return bar, bax


a, b = foo()
print(a())
print(b())
```

I'm trying to type it line by line:

```py
In [1]: def foo():
   ...:     def bar():
   ...:         return val
   ...:     def bax():
   ...:         nonlocal val
  Cell In[1], line 5
    nonlocal val
    ^
SyntaxError: no binding for nonlocal 'val' found
```
